steps.title: Launch site
details: Landing screen rendered without visible errors.

steps.title: Expect to see “Bill From” section (Step 1 of wizard)
details: System waited 5 s for an <h4> element containing text “Bill From  :”.
Element never appeared → hard failure; wizard either did not load or heading text/layout differs from expectation.

steps.title: Remaining form-entry and validation steps
details: Because the core UI element was not found, the test aborted and none of the data-entry, validation, persistence, or screenshot checks could run.

emotional_arc: A real user starts with optimism (site loads) but immediately hits confusion when the expected invoice wizard is not apparent. After a few seconds of uncertainty, frustration grows and confidence drops, likely causing the user to abandon or seek help.

qualitative_opportunities.area: Entry-point discoverability of the invoice wizard
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: If users do not instantly see where to begin creating an invoice, they feel lost and may leave.
next_actions: On first load, auto-open Step 1 of the wizard or show a prominent “Create invoice” CTA above the fold.
Add micro-copy or onboarding tooltip guiding first-time visitors.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Unexpected heading text, extra spaces, or styling changes break both automated tests and human pattern-recognition, reducing trust.
next_actions: Standardize wizard section titles and keep them semantically marked as <h*>, not buried in divs.
Add explicit data-testids so copy tweaks don’t break functionality visibility.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: 5 s of blank or ambiguous UI feels broken; users don’t know whether to wait or refresh.
next_actions: Display a skeleton loader or progress indicator while wizard assets initialize.
Lazy-load non-critical resources so Step 1 is interactive sooner.

qualitative_opportunities.area: State persistence between steps (not reached in test)
qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Users expect previously entered data to remain when they navigate back; losing it creates frustration.
next_actions: Ensure form values are cached locally (e.g., in context or localStorage) and repopulated on return.

qualitative_opportunities.why_it_matters: Clear, immediate error messages reduce form-completion anxiety.
next_actions: Show inline validation as soon as a field loses focus, not only on submit.
Use plain-language guidance (“Please enter your company name”).

first_tackles.description: Auto-launch or clearly expose the “Create Invoice” wizard on page load to eliminate the initial dead-end.
Add consistent semantic headings and stable data-testids for wizard sections (e.g., id="bill-from-heading").
Introduce a lightweight skeleton loader or spinner for the wizard so users know it is loading.
Implement inline, plain-language validation messages for required fields.
